free: #e Today, Buya, you came to my home.
#c 今天, Buya, 你來我家。
#e (It's) good. I am happy.
#c 很好,我很高興。
#n azu mawtu=isu, qa-lizaq aiku: 如果你來,我會高興
#e You came to visit me, your sister.
#c 你來拜訪我,你的姊姊。
#n lawut-an-ku qaqa-ku: 我拜訪我的哥哥/姊姊
#n m-lawut aiku tu qaqa-ku: 我拜訪我的哥哥/姊姊
#e I have nothing.
#c 我沒有什麼。
#e It doesn’t matter. Later, we will eat dinner and we will drink, said I.
#c 沒關係.等會,我們一起吃晚餐,我們喝酒,我說
#n patawsi-an-ku aizipna: 我請他喝酒
#e Okay.
#c 好的。
#e I haven’t come for a long time. I feel sorry too.
#c 我很久沒來,我也不好意思。
#n siRap qiRuziq-an-ku kelisiw-na, tangi m-siqaz=iku t<m>ayta timaizipana: ‘昨天我偷了他的錢,今天我不好意思見他’
#n qa-siqaz-an-ku: 我很不好意思的事
#n siRap m-suRaw=iku qa-siqaz-an waway-ku: ‘昨天,我跌倒,我的行為(讓人)不好意思’
#e We (lived) nearby, (but) I come here once in a while.
#c 我們(住的)近, (但)我很久才來一次。
#n nayau qawqa nengi: 那樣才好
#n qa-usiq=pama=iku matiw tayan q<m>an: 我才去那裡吃過一次
#e We do not visit (them), (and) it is bad for sisters.
#c 我們沒去拜訪, 對姊姊們不好。
#n zana baqian=ay Ribang zau: 那是老人家的東西
#e That’s right.
#c 這樣也是。
#e No matter where the relatives live, I would visit them even it’s far.
#c 親友不管在哪裡,很遠我也去拜訪。
#e In the past, in Hualien.
#c 以前在花蓮。
#e I went to Taipei.
#c 我去台北。
#e We went to see our relatives, I told you.
#c 我們去看親戚,我這樣跟你講。
#e There is you elder, Tipil.
#c 還有你的長輩,Tipil。
#e Visit him.
#c 你去拜訪他。
#e (If) you go, he has fish and he has wine.
#c 你去的話,他有魚他有酒。
#e There is.
#c 是有啊。
#e (these) are to treat you to drinking wine.
#c 是他要請你喝酒的。
#e He will call me.
#c 他也會叫我。
#e ‘Go,’ he said to me.
#c 他叫我去。
#e We do not have free time.
#c 我們沒有空閒。
#e It seems as if we did not know our elder, Tipil.
#c 好像我們裝做不知道我們的長輩, Tipil。
#e Not long ago, I went (there) once.
#c 之前,我去過一次。
#e By the road
#c 有在路邊。
#e (these) are to treat you to drinking wine.
#c 是他要請你喝酒的。
#e He will call me.
#c 他也會叫我。
#e ‘Go,’ he said to me.
#c 他叫我去。
#e We do not have free time.
#c 我們沒有空閒。
#e It seems as if we did not know our elder, Tipil.
#c 好像我們裝做不知道我們的長輩, Tipil。
#e Not long ago, I went (there) once.
#c 之前,我去過一次。
#e By the road.
#c 有在路邊。
#e They drank wine by the road.
#c 他們在路邊喝酒。
#e ‘Come in,’ they said to me.
#c ‘進來’,他們對我說。
#e We went in.
#c 我們就進去。
#n zukat: 出去
#e We were there chatting with them and their friends.
#c 我們在哪裡跟他們還有他們的朋友聊天。
#n silalaq-an-ku aizipna: ‘I chatted with him.’
#e They have many friends, also including the sister-in-law, Panay, his (Tipil’s) wife.
#c 他們的朋友很多, 還包括姐姐Panay, 就是他的(Tipil的)太太。
#n yau qaya zaku=ay kelisiw: ‘我也有錢’
#n yau qaya kelisiw: ‘還有錢’
#n aiku pataqsian, ti-ulaw pataqsian qaya: ‘我是學生, Ulaw也是學生’
#e Tipil said to me, “If (you) have time, come (to visit me) again.”
#c Tipil跟我說,如果有時間的話,就再來喔。
#n matiw=iku tangi, amawaR qatiw=iku uman: ‘我今天去, 我明天還要去’
#n matiw=iku tangi, amawaR uman=iku qatiw: ‘我今天去, 我明天還要去’
#e I said, “Okay.”
#c 我說好。
#n en ‘yes’; usa ‘no’
#e It’s been a long time since I went there last time as (going that far to visit him) is tiring.
#c 我也很久沒去了, (跑那麼遠去)很累阿。
#e Maybe that would hurt his heart, making him wonder why this child would not come to see me.
#c 他也許會心痛, 想說為什麼這孩子不來看我呢?
#e Yes.
#c 對。
#e For example, (when) I go to Keelong, (that is), I go to brother Angaw’s place.
#c 比方說我去基隆, 我去Angaw哥哥那邊的時候。
#n zuma: ‘比方說/譬如’ ‘有時候’ ‘不一樣’
#n matiw=imi sa kilung, zuma t<m>eqez=imi q<m>an sa-tutul tazian: ‘我們去基隆, 有時候留在那邊吃午餐’
#n mana zuma zasu ‘你的為什麼不一樣’.#n usa zuma zasu=ay? ‘你的不是不一樣嗎?’
#n ’staR/zuma qudus-niq ‘我們的衣服一樣/不一樣’
#n ’staR-an-ku tu sikawma-an-na ‘我說的跟他說的一樣’
#n ’staR-an-ku tu qudus-na s<m>angi ‘我做的衣服跟他做的衣服一樣’
#e Why is it that the one who came was you only?
#c 為什麼來的只有你呢?
#e Why didn’t (those guys such as) Amuy and Buya come as well?’
#c 為什麼Amuy和Buya他們那些人沒有來呢?
#n qani-ulaw matiw sa taipak ‘Ulaw等人(Ulaw等一夥人)去台北’
#n paqenanem=iku ta-lepaw-an-ku ‘我一個人在家’
#e They don’t come to visit me.
#c 那些人不來拜訪我。
#e I cannot walk.
#c 我不會走路了。
#e I’m a bit tired.
#c 只是有點累。
#e I don’t know the way (to your palce), said he.
#c 我不知道路, 他這樣說。
#e I said, ‘All right, I’ll tell them to come. They must come to visit (you).’
#c 我說 ‘好, 我會跟他們說, 叫他們一定要來拜訪。'
#n quni-a-kita 沒辦法
#e How do I know how children go visiting. If we do go.
#c 我怎麼知道小孩如何拜訪的. 我們真的去的話。
#n 此處的qawman=zuma
#n qawman=iku qawtu ‘我一定/絕對會來’
#n qawman aizipna ‘一定是他了’
#n maqen sinsi aizipna zin-ku ‘我覺得他一定老師’
#n taRni=iku sunis a yau naquni ni-lawut-an-na: ‘我怎麼知道小孩子們如何拜訪的’
#n taRni=iku qumni qautu-an-na = taRni=iku qumni qawtu aizipna: ‘我怎麼知道他什麼時候會來’
#n sanu-an-ku qaniyau: ‘我跟他們講過了’
#n quni=pa=isu ‘你要做什麼’
#n nayau-an-su s<m>anu ‘你那樣說 (indicative)’
#n nayau-ika s<m>anu ‘你那樣說 (imperative)’
#e He will absolutely tell us, “Why didn’t you visit (me)?”
#c 他絕對會跟我們說, “你們怎麼都沒有來”
#e We didn’t (go), and that’s it.
#c 我們沒有(去), 就那樣。
#e We only have him as our elder here, I think.
#c 我想我們在這邊的長輩只剩下他(Tipil)了。
#e Yes, we dance here every year.
#c 是阿, 的確是這樣, 我們每年都在這裡跳舞。
#e I also gave him an invitation card.
#c 我也給他邀請卡。
#n sa-qawtu-an (要他來的東西, 如邀請卡等)
#e Invitation card. I tell him to come.
#c 邀請卡. 我叫他來。
#e There are some problems with his legs. (He) cannot walk. (He) cannot come.
#c 他的腳有問題,不能走路不能來。
#e the harvest ritual of Kavalan for the second time in Year 83
#c 八十三年第二次噶瑪蘭的豐年祭。
#n saqa-usiq: 第一次
#n saqa-yau: 最先
#n saqalikuz: 最後
#c 九十三。
#c 九十三。
#e I was surprised that brother ‘zun came.
#c 我很驚訝’zun哥哥有來。
#n pa-Retut-an-ku aizipna: 我嚇他
#n pa-Retut-an-na aiku: 他嚇我
#n mu-Retut=iku tu ni-qawtu-an na qaqa ti-‘zun: 我很驚訝’zun哥哥的到來
#n yau=ti qaqa-ku (mawtu): 我哥哥來了
#n mawtu=ti uman qaqa-ku: 我哥哥又來了
#n yau=ti qaqa-ku mawtu uman: 我哥哥又來了
#e Others said that he was sick.
#c 別人說他生病了。
#e ‘How come my brother ‘zun was there?,’ said I.
#c 'zun哥哥怎麼會在呢?'我說。
#e I was glad that my brother came.
#c 我高興我哥哥來了。
#n qena-qenut-ku tu mai ni-qawtu-na: 我氣他沒來
#n qena-pilay-ku tu ni-kelawqaway-an-ku: 我累是因為我的工作
#n qena-qenut-ku timaizipana: 我氣他
#e Thus, I would like to go to tipil’s place.
#c 所以我想到tipil那邊去。
#e How come only he didn’t come?
#c 為何只有他沒來?
#e Thus, I told you (this).
#c 所以我才跟你說。
#e (If) you have car, next time take him to our house, to Taipei (for) the harvest ritual.
#c 下次,你有車子的話,帶他到我們家到台北來我們的豐年祭。
#e I told you so.
#c 我這樣跟你說。
#e Our elder ‘zun came yesterday.
#c 我們的長輩’zun昨天來。
#e I was surprised to see the elder.
#c 我很驚訝看到長輩。
#e Our uncle hasn’t seen (us) for a long time.
#c 我們的舅舅很久沒見到(我們)。
#e Today, he participated in our gathering here.
#c 今天他參加我們這裡的聚會。
#n qena-lisinbu: 聚會
#e We danced there, said I.
#c 我們在那裡跳舞,我說。
#e I took him, holding his hand, to...
#c 我帶著他,牽著他的手,到...
#e To the front.
#c 在前面。
#e To the front.
#c 在前面。
#e (I) asked him to sit in the front.
#c (我)請他坐到前面。
#e He probably said in his heart, ‘I am glad to see the children, my juniors.’
#c 他在心裡應該這麼想, ‘我很高興看到孩子,我的晚輩’ 。
#e Our behavior of Kavalan should be like that: Don’t forget our relatives.
#c 我們噶瑪蘭的行為應該這樣:不要忘了親友。
#e We cannot forget our relatives.
#c 我們不能忘記全部的長輩。
#e Who would forget the relatives here?
#c 誰會忘記這裡的親友?
#e We should remember all our relatives.
#c 我們應該記得我們全部的親友。
#e Where are the elders?
#c 那些長輩在哪裡?
#e ‘I am old (so) I cannot walk. My body is not good.’ said they.
#c 我老了不能走路了,我身體不好,他們說。
#e We cannot participate in our gathering.
#c 我們不參加我們的聚會。
#e If there is a wedding,
#c 如果哪邊有婚禮，
#e We will definitely go and help (if) they do not have enough people.
#c 我們一定去幫忙工作,(如果)他們人手不足。
#e We must help (them).
#c 我們一定要幫忙。
#e If there is wedding or funeral, we will go there with our children, said I.
#c 像結婚和有喪事的我們帶著孩子去, 我說。
#e (Those who) have boys must do this.
#c 我們有生男生的要這麼做。
#n nayau-an-ku qelawkaway: 我那樣做
#e I told (my child) Aki this: Aki, you’ve grown up.
#c 我跟(我的孩子)Aki這麼說:Aki你長大了, 年紀大了。
#e If so, you should visit relatives often, said I.
#c 如果這樣的話,你要常常拜訪親友, 我說。
#e Mother said so.
#c 媽媽那樣說。
#e (I) don’t know where he went. ‘I’m going to work,’ said he.
#c 不知道去哪裡,他說:我去上班了。
#e Don’t go to work. Come and listen to our stories, said I.
#c 你先不要上班,來聽我們的故事,我說。
#e I’m going to work, said he.
#c 我要去上班,他說。
#e He has work. There is nothing we can do.
#c 他有工作,我們沒辦法。
#n naquni-a-kita: 我們要怎麼辦?
#e If you have him stay,
#c 如果你把他留下來。
#n palez-an-na aiku: 他把我留下來。
#n palez-an-ku qaniyau: 我留下他們。
#e I have work. If I leave, who will do the job? Wouldn’t he think so?
#c 我有工作,如果我走了,誰要幫我做?他不會這樣想嗎?
#e That’s right.
#c 也對啦！
#e Our gathering here has existed for a long time.
#c 我們在這裡(指北區)的聚會已經辦很久了。
#e Almost 15 (years).
#c 快15(年)了。
#e Our gathering here has lasted for almost fifteen years.
#c 我們在這裡的聚會已經快十五年了。
#e Why did we set up this gathering?
#c 我們為什麼要成立這個同鄉會?
#e You know that.
#c 你也知道啊!
#e If something happens, we can have a chat.
#c 如果有事情我們才會聊聊談談。
#n sin-sanu: 交談 = sim-sanu
#e If there are those who need help, we will go help our relatives.
#c 如果有要幫忙的人,我們會去幫忙。
#e The gathering is for this kind of idea.
#c 我們成立同鄉會是為了這樣的想法。
#e The activity whereby we would gather together.
#c 我們要聚在一起的活動。
#e That’s it. We have to do so.
#c 就是這樣,我們就是要這樣做。
#e We won't forget one another. That's okay.
#c 我們不會忘記對方,就可以。
#e We are separated far away (from each other).
#c 分散的很遠。
#e Some live in Taipei; some in Banqiao; some in Xinzhuang.
#c 有在台北的,有在板橋的,有在新莊的。
#e Some live in Taipei; some in Banqiao; some in Xinzhuang.
#c 有在台北的,有在板橋的,有在新莊的。
#e We elders do not have cars.
#c 像我們老人沒有車子。
#e We stay at home with children.
#c 我們跟小孩在家。
#e You have cars and should visit (others) often so that (they) would not forget us.
#c 你們有車子的要常去拜訪,(他們)才不會忘記我們。
#e Children would not forget the language of Kavalan.
#c 小孩子才不會忘記噶瑪蘭話。
#e If we go there, they would definitely be happy.
#c 我們去的話,他們一定很高興。
#e We would say, ‘Teach your children.’
#c 我們說:教你們的小孩子。
#e If they teach the children, they will know (the language).
#c 教的話,小孩子才會知道(我們的語言)。
#e We didn’t say that they did not teach Kavalan.
#c 我們沒有說他們沒有教噶瑪蘭。
#e We would lose Kavalan (our language). We cannot do so.
#c 我們會失去(我們的語言)噶瑪蘭,我們不能這樣。
#e What you said is right.
#c 你這樣說沒錯
#e Is it (the Kavalan language) going to survive in the future?
#c (噶瑪蘭語)以後還會有嗎?
#e Like what you’ve said, our language might disappear.
#c 就像你所說的, 我們的語言可能就消失了。
#e If we should lose our language, what could we do?
#c 我們沒有語言的話, 那該怎麼辦?
#e Only the old can teach (the Kavalan language).
#c 只有老人家才會教(噶瑪蘭語)。
#e If (our) children grow up without following our own language,
#c 小孩子長大後, 沒有追隨著我們的語言的話。
#e Will our language still survive?
#c 我們的語言還會存留下來嗎?
#e (Our language) may be lost right there.
#c (我們的語言)就斷在那裡了。
#n maqetun=ti ipit ‘筷子斷掉了’
#e Children may say “Grandpas, grandmas, teach us (Kavalan).”
#c 小孩子們也許會叫爺爺奶奶教他們(噶瑪蘭)。
#e (Because) now our children have so much to learn.
#c 因為我們的小孩子現在功課太多了。
#n sa-taqsi-an ‘要讀的東西; 功課’
#e We’ve seen, alas, their extremely full back-bags.
#c 我們也都看到了啊, 他們的書包都滿滿的。
#n Raybang-na puniR tu sudad ‘他的書包裝滿了書

gloss: 如何-處焦-3PL.屬格=未來=完成

free: #e Into their heads.
#c 到他們的腦袋裡面。
#e We wonder how they manage to stuff all these books into their heads.
#c 我們就在想他們如何能把那麼多書裝進腦袋裡去。
#e Today there are other (problems), like, if (we) want to teach our language,
#c 今天還有其他的(問題), 比方說, 要教我們的語言的話。
#n azu tangi yau ni-kasianem-an tu pa-tud-an tu sikawman-ta: ‘比如說, 我在想, 我們要教我們的母語’
#e (teach) something about Kavalan
#c (教)噶瑪蘭的東西。
#n zana pataqsian ‘學生的’
#e (teach) something about Kavalan
#c (教)噶瑪蘭的東西。
#e That’s good.
#c 那好啊。
#e If there is someone (for them) to follow,
#c 比方說, 有可以跟隨(學習)的人的話 。
#e The Kavalan (language) will not disappear.
#c 噶瑪蘭(的語言)才不會消失。
#e Our posterity will learn (the Kavalan language).
#c 我們的子子孫孫就能學習(噶瑪蘭的語言)。
#e (Our language) may survive, and our language may not disappear. I told you so.
#c (我們的語言)才會存留下來, 那個, 我們的語言才不會沒有(i.e.消失),我這樣跟你說。
#n tuluz-an-ku aizipna matiw sa lazing ‘我派他去海邊(出差)’
#e That’s right.
#c 是那樣沒錯。
#e Yes, now the teaching of Mandarin is in the same situation.
#c 是啊, 現在教國語的語言也是那樣。
#n ngay-ngay 客家人 zana ngay-ngay=ay sikawman 客語
#n busus 閩南人 zana busus=ay sikawman 閩南語
#n Rulam 外省人 zana Rulam=ay sikawman 國語
#e They took out their stories for children to learn.
#c 他們把他們的故事拿出來讓小孩學。
#e Can’t we also use Kavalan (stories to teach our children) in a similar manner? Won’t it work as well?
#c 我們就用類似的方法把噶瑪蘭的(故事)拿出來(教小孩), 難道不行嗎?
#n naquni Raqiya ‘那事情怎樣了’
#n siRab busuR=iku, naquni=iku Raqiya ‘我昨天很醉, 我不知道怎麼了’
#e No matter what may happen, we should work hard to teach our kids.
#c 無論如何, 我們都要認真教小孩子。
#e (Only in this way) are there going to be what to learn and what to write with.
#c (這樣才)可能有可以學習的東西和可以用來紀錄的東西。
#n qa-sudad-an = sa-sudad-an
#n qa-qan-an 零嘴 sa-qan-na 要吃的
#n zani tinu=ay sudad ‘nay ? ‘那本書是誰的’
#n tinu s<m>udad=ay tu sudad ‘nay ‘那個字/那本書是誰寫的’
#e In case they’d like to teach their friends.
#c 他們要教全部的朋友的話。
#e Their friends can understand.
#c 他們的朋友才會懂。
#e They would possibly undertand the Kavlan (language), I think.
#c 才會懂噶瑪蘭的語言, 我想。
#e If in the future they say, ‘We came here (ngengi’s place) once,’
#c 如果以後他們說: 我們來過(ngengi這裡)。
#e (they) will also teach our language in that way.
#c 也會那樣子教我們的語言。
#n pa-taqsi-an: student
#n tuluz-an-ku aizipna tud tu pataqsian: 我派他去教學生
#n pa-tud-an-ku aizipna tu pataqsian:我讓他去教學生
#e I told you so, Buya.
#c 我這樣跟你講,Buay。
#e I told you so, Buya.
#c 我這樣跟你講,Buay。
#e I told you so, Buya.
#c 我這樣跟你講,Buay。
#e I told you so, Buya.
#c 我這樣跟你講,Buay。
#e I told you so, Buya.
#c 我這樣跟你講,Buay。
#e You have to speak well ... teach the students.
#c 你要好好地講 ... 教學生。
#n qa-nengi-aykati: 好好做
#n nengi=ti=isu skawma: 你可以講
#n qa-nengi-aykati aisu kelawkaway: 你要好好地工作
#e You have to do your best to teach all the friends of these two (students), I told you so.
#c 你要好好教這兩位全部的朋友,我這樣跟你講。
#n qani-imuy: imuy他們
#n qani-tinu: 哪些人
#n qani-zau: 那位
#n pa-qa-nengi-aykati kelawkaway-an-su:把你的工作做好
#n pa-qa-nengi-aykati ni-tud-an-su: 你教的要好好做
#e What we said is right.
#c 我們這樣講沒錯。
#e I have an idea to set up courses to teach our children here.
#c 我有一個想法,成立教我們孩子的課程。
#n yau anem-ku, mai maseq lima-ku: ‘我有心,但做不到(手到不了)’
#e The superior wants us to ... What should we do?
#c 上級要我們怎麼做才會好。
#e It’s good if you express your ideas.
#c 把你們的構想講出來才可以。
#n pa-zukat-ika qenasianem-su: 把你的看法講出來。
#n ninu qenasianem-su tangi: ‘你剛才想的是什麼?’
#n ninu ni-kasianem-an-su tangi: ‘你剛才想的是什麼?’
#e We will think about how to finance children’s education, said they.
#c 我們會想辦法怎麼補助經費給小孩的教育用,他們說。
#e Oh.
#c 嗯。
#e I am willing to..., and I have drafted (a project).
#c 是有心,我有寫(計劃)。
#n yau anem-na saiza: 他可能有心
#n *yau anem-ku saiza
#e It is not yet complete.
#c 還沒完整。
#e It is not finished yet.
#c 還沒出來。
#e Later, maybe next year.
#c 再等一下,或許明年。
#e (The courses) we will teach our children will be completed.
#c 我們要教小孩的(課程)會出來。
#n palan-an-ku aizipna: 我等他
#n palan aiku zin-ku timaizipana:我叫他等我
#e We elders still want to learn and understand more about the language of Kavalan again, which we should understand.
#c 我們老人家還要再更了解自己應該懂的噶瑪蘭話。
#e I will (attend classes) there again.
#c 我還要再去那裡聽。
#e I will study there again.
#c 我還要再去那裡學。
#e Don’t the elders think so?
#c 老人們不是這樣想嗎?
#e I’m not referring to children only.
#c 我不是只針對小孩。
#e If (the elders) they want to study there,
#c 如果(老人家)他們有心想到那邊學習。
#e We will accept all of them.
#c 我們全都接收。
#e That’s it. For example when we sometimes go dancing and singing,
#c 的確是那樣. 比方說我們有時候去唱歌跳舞的時候。
#e They’d say ‘Oh, here come the Kavalan people.’
#c 他們就會說「喔, 噶瑪蘭人來了」。
#e How can I teach?
#c 我怎麼教呢?
#e Only if there are places for learning would it be convenient for me to teach. ‘I’m willing to teach you,’ I said.’
#c 如果有可以學的地方的話, 我才好教. 我說「我很願意教你們」。
#e They said, ‘Oh, what should we do? Teach us two or three (sentences).’
#c 他們說「喔, 我們該怎麼辦呢? 教我們兩三句吧」。
#e For instance, take a look at the Qataban festival that took place the other day.
#c 比方說, 你看看前陣子的Qataban豐年祭。
#e We were there with dungi, whom you often get together with.
#c 我們在那裡跟dungi一起, 就是你們常跟他在一起的那個dungi。
#e They said, ‘Hurry up! Sing the Kavalan songs.’ So we started to sing the Kavalan songs.
#c 他們說「快點來唱噶瑪蘭的歌!」於是我們就開始唱噶瑪蘭的歌了。
#e I don’t know why you guys’s pronunciation turned out to be like this. You guys cannot speak.
#c 不知道為什麼你們的發音會那樣,你們都不會說。
#e We Kavalan are not like that.
#c 我們噶瑪蘭人才不會那樣。
#e As long as it’s spoken once, we’d understand it.
#c 只要說了一次, 我們就懂了。
#n qa-usiq=iku t<m>ita timaicipana ‘我見過他一次’
#e (Whether it is) Japanese, Mandarin, Amis, or any other languges. They said, ‘you (Kavalan) are good at speaking languages.’
#c 不管是說日語,國語,阿美語,還是任何語言其他語言. 他們說「你們(噶瑪蘭)都會說」。’
#n 謝宗修老師認為此處的 “man”應為 “tan”
#e They said to me, ‘Wow, you Kavalan people are really skillful.’
#c 他們跟我說 「哇, 你們噶瑪蘭人真的很厲害捏。」
#e They said, ‘We are going to learn the Kavalan language.’
#c 他們說「我們打算要學噶瑪蘭語」。
#e They said to me, ‘Okay, we’re going to learn.’
#c 他們跟我說「好啊, 我們要去學」。
#e It’s good that you’re the one who teaches.
#c 你來教的話,很好啊。
#e It’s good that there’s someone who can teach. I am quite happy about it.
#c 有人教就很高興了。
#e So many of them said, ‘Teach us.’
#c 因此, 他們很多人就說「教我們啊」。
#e They said, ‘How come we cannot understand what you said?’
#c 他們說「怎麼我們都聽不懂你們說的話」。
#e I think we Kavalan people are quite competent.
#c 這樣說來, 我想我們噶瑪蘭人是很厲害的。
#e That’s true. (We) can respond to any languages of others.
#c 真的是這樣, (我們)能夠回應別人說的任何語言。
#e We Kavalan people will not be criticized.
#c 我們噶瑪蘭人不會被人家批評。
#e Indeed, we may not be criticized.
#c 沒錯, 就不會被批評了。
#e So that’s the way we Kavalan behave. We’re very competent.
#c 我們噶瑪蘭人的舉止就是像那樣, 非常能幹。
#e We can acquire it at once. We think we are not like them. I don’t know why their tongues always knot up.
#c 馬上就能學會, 不像他們不知道為什麼舌頭老是會打結。
#e Their speech also gets twisted. What shall we do about it?
#c 他們講的話還會歪七扭八. 我們該怎麼才好呢?’
#e They know the language (Amis). We understand their language (Amis) as well.
#c 他們會的話(Amis),我們也會聽他們的話(Amis)。
#e When they hear us speaking our language, Kavalan,
#c 他聽到我們講自己的噶瑪蘭話時。
#e How come they would think that we were speaking ill of them?
#c 他們怎麼會認為我們說他們的壞話?
#e We were definitely not speaking ill of them.
#c 我們絕對沒有說他們的壞話。
#n qimanung=iku ti-utai-an: 我講utai的壞話,我批評utai
#e ‘You are speaking ill of us,’ said they.
#c 他們說:你們講我們的壞話。
#e They don’t understand (Kavalan).
#c 只是他們不會聽而已。
#e They said, ‘You were speaking ill of (us),’ but we were not speaking ill (of them.)
#c 他們說 ‘你們講壞話,’(可是),我們沒有講壞話。
#e We met Amuy.
#c 我們和Amuy碰面。
#e We spoke Kavalan.
#c 我們講噶瑪蘭。
#e What were you two talking about?
#c 你們兩個在講什麼?
#e How come it seems that we could not understand (Kavalan), said they.
#c 為什麼我們好像,我們不會聽, 他們這麼說。
#n estaR aisu tu tama-su: 你像你爸爸
#e When we met, you spoke Amis.
#c 我們在一起時,你們都講Amis。
#e ‘We know Amis. How come we are like this. We do not understand (Kavalan),’ said they.
#c 他們說:我們也知道Amis, 我們怎麼會這樣子, 我們都不會(噶瑪蘭) 。
#e Some time ago, we had the harvest festival ‘qataban.’
#c 前陣子我們豐年祭。
#e Last night, we went to the park, and they did so again.
#c 昨天晚上,我們去公園,也是那樣。
#e ‘Amuy, pickcle the laver,’ said I.
#c 我說: amuy,把紫菜醃一醃。
#e ‘What were you critizing for?,’ said they (Amis).
#c 他們(Amis)說:你們說了什麼壞話。
#e We did not speak ill (of somebody.
#c 我們不是說壞話。
#e Pickle the laver and green seaweed.
#c 醃紫菜和綠海菜。
#n puli=ay qudus: green clothes
#n baRi=ay: red
#n pusaR=ay: white
#n tengen=ay: black
#e ‘There is pepper and there is salt,’ said I.
#c 我說,有辣椒,有鹽。
#e Amuy pickled (the laver and green seaweed).
#c Amui就醃(紫菜和綠海菜) 。
#e ‘Who took them?’ said they.
#c 他們說,是誰拿的?
#e (Amui said,) ‘It’s I, or who would take them?’
#c (Amui說,)是我,不然是誰拿的。
#e My child went to pick laver, said I.
#c 我說: 我的小孩去撿紫菜。
#e You child is competent.
#c 你的小孩很厲害。
#e ‘We Kavalan only have the sea,’ said we.
#c 我們噶瑪蘭只有海邊。
#e We go to the sea.
#c 我們去海邊。
#e Males perhaps go pick laver, Taiwanese abalone, and lobsters.
#c 男生可能去撿紫菜九孔和龍蝦。
#e (As for) we females, we perhaps go pick chitons and limpets.
#c 我們女生,我們可能就去撿石鱉和笠螺。
#e We cooked on the seaside.
#c 就在海邊煮了。
#e We Kavalan, we roast (them).
#c 我們噶瑪蘭,我們用火烤。
#n ma-temaq lepaw: 房子燒起來了
#e Like my sister, Awun, when we came back from the sea,
#c 像我的妹妹Awun,我們從海邊回來的時候。

gloss: 使役-集中-處焦-3PL.屬格=完成

free: #e We took vegetable and what we had picked. We gathered and washed them.
#c 我們拿菜,我們撿的東西,使集中,清洗。
#e (We) put them in a container made of the leaves of betel nut trees.
#c 放在檳榔葉做的容器裡。
#n padu是指用檳榔葉做的容器
#e After burning stones,
#c 燒完石頭之後。
#e After becoming boiling hot, what we cooked were delicious.
#c 滾燙後,很好吃。
#e We did in this way, and would not make the pot dirty.
#c 我們這樣做,不會髒。
#e If we cooked, the pot would become black.
#c 如果我們用煮的,鍋子會變黑。
#e Yes.
#c 對。
#e If there is something that can be roasted, you can also roast it.
#c 如果有(可以)烤的(東西), 你也可以用烤的。
#e We roast fish to the extent that they smell good.
#c 我們把魚烤到很香。
#n 我把魚烤焦了, 不是 “m-litungtung=iku tu baut”, 而是“ni-temaq-an-ku=ay baut m-litungtung”(我烤的魚焦了)
#e Yes.
#c 對.
#e When they smell good, the fish soup also turns red.
#c 魚很香了以後, 魚湯也就紅了。
#n 此處為噶瑪蘭人特殊的料理方式, 將魚烤熟, 直至香味四溢之後, 便將魚放入鍋子等盛器之中, 注入冷水, 輔以各種香料, 便成一道魚湯, 而冷水則因沾染魚體內的肉汁而轉白為紅, 此種料理方式稱為 “sabengneq”
#e Don’t cook with the wok.
#c 不要用鍋子煮。
#e We can still (cook fish) simply in a manner of “sabengneq” instead.
#c 我們只要用Sabengneq的方式料理魚就可以了。
#e Indeed, that’s the way it is.
#c 的確是那樣。

gloss: 一種料理魚的方式-處焦

free: #e Only our “Sabengneq” is the real Kavalan way of roasting fish.
#c 只有Sabengneq才是真正的噶瑪蘭的烤魚方式。

gloss: 完成-在海邊撿食物-名物化

free: #e All that we get is collected along the coastline.
#c 我們在海邊的收穫全部都是在海邊撿東西。
#e Indeed, that’s the way it is.
#c 的確是那樣。
#e (When) we Kavalan go to the sea,
#c 我們噶瑪蘭去海邊的時候。
#e For example, we go to the riverside.
#c 像去河邊。
#e For example, my father.
#c 比方說, 我爸爸。
#e My father said, ‘Let’s go. We’re going to the river.’
#c 我爸爸說「走吧, 我們去河邊」。
#e He prepared the hoe, the dustpan maybe, and his ‘bubu’.
#c 就準備了鋤頭, 畚箕, 還有他的bubu。
#n 噶瑪蘭的捕魚工具, 皆為竹製, 此處提到的主要有三種: bubu, qepitan, sangku
#n “bubu”狀似梯形, 下方有一開口, 魚蝦只能進不能出
#n “qepitan” 類似bubu但尺寸較小, 通常於撿拾魚蝦時攜帶在肩膀上
#n “sangku” 尺寸最大, 裝似圓錐, 上方有一原形開口, 構造類似 “bubu”
#e There we went to the river.
#c 於是我們就去了河邊。
#e He was going to block the river, wasn’t he?
#c 是要去擋住河流了吧。
#e He (my father) said, ‘We’re going to obsrtruct...’
#c 他(我爸爸)說, 「我們要堵住...」
#e We went to obstruct the great river.
#c 我們就去把那條大河流堵住。

gloss: 東翻西找-處焦-1EPL.屬格=完成

free: #e After it was done, we looked here and there (on the bed of the river) for shrimps, ‘kumu’, or crabs.
#c 把河流堵好了以後, 我們就到處翻找蝦子啦, Kumu魚啦, 或是螃蟹等等。
#n 噶瑪蘭人在河邊捕魚時, 首先將河流上游堵住, 然後在乾涸的下游河床撿拾魚蝦蟹類, 同時在上游會放置bubu(開口朝下游), 在下游則放置sangku(開口朝上游), 當撿拾工作結束後, 在將堵住的河流疏通, 剩下的魚蝦便順著河水由上游流入sangku當中, 此段會話便是對此過程的描述.
#e After we finished picking everything,
#c 我們把全部都撿完以後。

gloss: 使役-一種捕魚的工具-處焦-3SG.屬格=完成

free: #e He put the Bubu downstream.
#c 就把Bubu放在下面。
#e Being afraid that the floating shrimps and fish might run away,
#c 因為怕漂流的魚蝦會跑走。

gloss: 朝向-上面-處焦-3SG.屬格=完成

free: #e He made the Sangku face upstream.
#c 於是就把Sangku(的開口)面向上游。
#e ‘Eat.. let’s have lunch,’ he said.
#c 「吃...我們去吃午餐吧」他說。
#e Perhaps when we were cooking or when we had finished our lunch,
#c 可能我們還在煮飯,或是已經吃完的時候。
#e The Bubu was still there. When the shrimps went downstream,
#c Bubu還放在河裡. 當蝦子往下游的時候。
#e That’s good.
#c 很好。
#e (The shrimps) would be caught in the Bubu.
#c (蝦子)就會被Bubu盛接住。
#e So we don’t have to look for them.
#c 這樣我們就不用到處翻石頭找魚蝦了。
#n “Raypati”也可以表示「不用;不需要」

gloss: 一種捕魚的工具-處格-3SG.屬格
處格-一種捕魚的工具-處格
free: #e All (shrimps) would enter the Sangku.
#c 全部的(蝦子)都會進到sangku。
#n 如前所述, Bubu是放在上游處, Sangku才是放在下游處, 故此處Buya意在糾正Ngengi所說的Bubu應該是Sangku才對.
#e Yes, maybe only crabs would not go downstream.
#c 是啊, 可能只有螃蟹不會往下游走。
#e So we turned over the stones.
#c 所以我們就把石頭翻開。
#e We picked up the crabs that would not go downstream.
#c 我們就去撿那些不會往下游走的螃蟹。
#e That’s Kavalan’s custom.
#c 那樣就是噶瑪蘭人的習俗。
#e Indeed, that is the way it was in the village before.
#c 以前在村莊的時候,真的是這樣。
#e That’s all we did, such as looking for (shrimps, fish, crabs, etc.) and going to the seashore, to the river.
#c 不管是去找尋魚蝦啦, 還是去河邊, 去海邊啦, 全部都是做這些事情。
#e That’s true. (We) cook nothing special.
#c 真的是這樣, (我們也)沒煮什麼。
#e If we only have those from the river, those from the river will be our dishes.
#c 只有河邊的東西的話, 我們的菜就是河邊的東西。
#e If we only have those from the sea, those from the sea will be our dishes.
#c 只有海邊的東西的話, 我們的菜就是海邊的東西。
#e I think that’s really the life Kavalan people lived in the village before.
#c 我想那的確是從前噶蘭人還住在村莊裡時的生活方式。
#e Like in the past when we were still in our village, in Xinshe.
#c 就像過去我們還在故鄉,在新社時。

gloss: 撿海邊的食物=未來=1IPL.主格

free: #e ‘Let’s go pick up food at sea,’ said Grandmother.
#c 阿媽說: 我們去海邊撿食物吧。
#e Let’s go ... this ... Let’s go to the sea, said they
#c 他們說: 我們去這個,我們去海邊。
#e We packed rice.
#c 我們包了飯。
#e The things we packed were only salt and pepper.
#c 包的東西只有鹽和辣椒。
#n ni-tabu-an-na = ni-tabu-na: 他包的東西
#e We went to the sea.
#c 我們到了海邊。
#e We began to pick up food.
#c 我們就開始撿食物。
#e We returned after picking up food at the seashore.
#c 我們去海邊撿食物回來了。
#e We picked many things.
#c 我們採的東西很多。
#e In addition, we had guests from Fong-bin or elsewhere.
#c 另外,我們有客人來,從豐濱那裡。
#e They still cannot pick up food at the seashore.
#c 他們還不會在海邊撿海菜
#n Raygu=iku kya: 我真的不會呀。
#e ‘Wow! You knew how to pick up food at sea,’ said they.
#c 他們說: 哇!你們很會撿海邊的東西。
#e ‘Someday go to the sea and help us,’ said they.
#c 他們說: 改天去海邊幫我們。
#e After it’s done, they could not preserve the meat. (The food) would rot.
#c 完成後,他們不會醃, 會臭掉。
#n RumeR: 醃菜
#n m-umas: 醃肉

gloss: 撿海邊的食物-名物化-3PL.屬格
free: #e (so) they cooked all they had picked.
#c (所以)他們撿的東西全都用煮的。
#e They were like that in the past.
#c 他們以前就是那樣。
#e Only we Kavalan are able to pick up food at sea ... the meals.
#c 只有我們噶瑪蘭很會撿海邊的東西,要吃的菜。
#e Look, they did not know how to pick food at seaside in the past.
#c 看,Amuy他們以前不會撿海邊的食物。
#e They tilled the land in the past and did not have time.
#c 他們以前耕田,沒有時間。
#e (They) did not have time to go to the sea.
#c 沒有時間去海邊。
#e There was no one who could teach them (what they should pick up when) going to the sea.
#c 又沒有人教他們去海邊(撿什麼) 。
#e How did we do with what we picked at sea?
#c 撿回來的東西怎麼處理?
#e They might not be able to preserve what they had taken back.
#c 他們拿回來的東西,他們不會醃。
#e (The food) would rot, (so) they could only cook them.
#c 臭掉了,他們只好用煮的。
#e Our grandmother in the past ... their chitons ... after three months’ preserving, they opened (the container).
#c 我們阿媽以前,他們的石鱉,(醃了)三個月後,打開。
#e There were no shells but only meat.
#c 石鱉的殼就掉落了,只有剩下肉了。
#n sutu-tamun=ti: 只剩下菜了
#n wantima qaniyau kin-tulu: 只剩下他們三人
#e In any event, the things our grandmother preserved were like that.
#c 不管怎麼樣,我們阿媽以前醃的東西就是那樣做的。
#e Could our children now pick up food at seaside? No.
#c 像我們現在的小孩還會去撿海邊的食物嗎? 不會。
#e I want to teach your children.
#c 我想教你們的孩子。
#e I want to have them go to the sea and pick food there.
#c 我想讓他們去撿海邊的食物。
#n pa-qa-lizaq-an-ku=pa zaka: 我想要讓他高興(還未做)
#n ngid-an-ku pa-qa-lizaq *zaka: 我要讓他高興(比較直接)
#e or going to the river
#c 或者到河邊。
#e I’ll have Aki catch fish.
#c 我要讓Aki抓魚。
#n Aki是Ngengi的兒子
#e He has never seen how to catch fish.
#c 他從未看過如何抓魚。
#e How do we catch fish? Wouldn’t he think so?
#c 我們是怎麼抓魚的?他不會這樣想嗎?
#e (If) you teach him, he will certainly know it.
#c 你教他,他一定會的。
#e Next time if you have time, take all the children ...
#c 下次如果你有空,就帶全部的小孩們。
#e Teach them how we catch fish and how we pick up food at sea.
#c 你就教他們我們是如何抓魚,我們是如何在海邊撿食物的。
#e Tell them thus.
#c 你就這樣跟他們講。
#e That’s all of what we said today. Time is up.
#c 今天我們講的就這樣,我們已經超過那個了(指時間) 。
#e Okay.
#c 好的。
